text: Neotribalism (neo-tribalism; modern tribalism) is a sociological concept. The idea is that human beings have evolved to live in tribal society, as opposed to mass society. So they will naturally form social networks of new "tribes". Maffesoli, Michel 1996. The time of the tribes: the decline of individualism in mass society. London: Sage. == References == Category:Sociology
title: Neotribalism
